results.headline: Truth as a Tinderbox That Must Disappear
results.summary_short: The Iranian director Mohammad Rasoulof’s thriller “Manuscripts Don’t Burn” depicts a hunt by state assassins for a manuscript recounting an attempt to kill intellectuals.

results.headline: Two Bands of True Believers Hurtling Toward a Collision
results.summary_short: In the Israeli drama “Policeman,” an elite counterterrorism squad faces off with a band of youthful revolutionaries.

results.headline: Jesus, You’ll Be the Stick-Up Guy. SpongeBob, You’re a Lookout.

results.headline: Hackers Take a Road Trip, With a Sci-Fi Detour
results.summary_short: The director William Eubank reimagines reality and defies logic in “The Signal.”

results.headline: A Car Is Stolen, Setting Off an Angry Pursuit
results.summary_short: In “The Rover,” set in a bleak Australia, a man sets out for revenge after thugs take his vehicle.

results.headline: One Generation Passes; Another One Grumbles
results.summary_short: An obnoxious young man learns life lessons as his father nears death in “Lullaby,” the directorial debut of Andrew Levitas.

results.summary_short: “Ivory Tower,” a documentary from Andrew Rossi, explores the problems facing higher education today.

results.headline: From Invalid to Nanny, in a Twinkling of an Eye
results.summary_short: In “The Amazing Catfish,” an ailing young woman finds herself thrust into the family of a woman with whom she just shared a hospital room.

results.display_title: Nan Goldin: I Remember Your Face
results.headline: A Photographer Recalls Her Life Within a Demimonde
results.summary_short: This documentary follows Nan Goldin from Paris to Berlin, and interviews her subjects as well as the artist herself.

results.headline: He’s a Great Pet, Even if He Does Singe Your Hair

results.headline: A Woman Is Courted, but the Suitor Is Her Father
results.summary_short: The daughter of the screenwriter Roger Towne directs, writes and stars in her own film, “I Am I.”

results.headline: When Chaos Trumps Civility

results.headline: Marijuana’s Journey to Legitimacy
results.summary_short: “Evergreen: The Road to Legalization” examines the battle surrounding an initiative to permit possession of small amounts of recreational marijuana in Washington State.

results.headline: Just Like the Last One, Only Different

results.headline: What Ferris Bueller Hath Wrought
results.summary_short: In “Where We Started,” a man and woman meet while staying at a West Texas motel and consider leaving their respective married lives for each other.

results.headline: A Detective Who Is More Softy Than Hard-Boiled
results.summary_short: “Breakthrough Weekend” is a New York shaggy-dog story that involves an unusual private detective and his protégé, who take on three increasingly bizarre cases.

results.headline: Czech Pawns In a System That Stifled
results.summary_short: “Burning Bush” uses the case of a martyr to help depict life under totalitarianism in Czechoslovakia after the 1968 Soviet invasion.
